footer.code-description-link: An independent, non-partisan, non-political, non-governmental organization.

content.video-message: Please provide links from Youtube or Vimeo.

homepage.introduction: Welcome to Theater Hub, the online platform dedicated to independent theater in Romania and the Republic of Moldova. If you are an actor, director, sound engineer or screenwriter create an account today, fill in your profile and start a project together with the community.
homepage.how-it-works-item-1: Create an account in Theater Hub and fill in your profile. This way you could be contacted by other groups to participate in projects or you could start your own.
homepage.how-it-works-item-2: After adding a new project you can ask for help in the community to turn it into reality. Do you need lights, a poster, decor or maybe a screenwriter? Post your announcement and convince other people to join you.
homepage.how-it-works-item-3: Don’t forget about the larger audience. Promote your projects here and keep people in the loop with the latest news about your future show in order to promote it better.

sign-up.title: Sign Up
sign-up.submit-success-message: An e-mail containing a link for confirming the registration has been sent.

about.title: About this project
about.paragraph-1: Theater Hub is a project developed by Code for Romania in partnership with Punct.Art. This platform aims to be a support for the independent theater community in both Romania and the Republic of Moldova. Members who create an account in the platform will be able to build a profile, add their portfolios and register to take part in diverse projects all over the two countries.
about.paragraph-2: The purpose of Theater Hub is to facilitate the communication between independent theater groups, to encourage collaboration and building common projects, to help initiatiors get in touch easier with various other specialists - designers, marketeers, sound engineers, filmmakers etc - and to support them in promoting their shows.
about.paragraph-3: The Theater Hub platform has been developed pro-bono by Code for Romania volunteers with the support and know-how from Punct.Art. You may support the two initiatives by sharing this platform and by donating directly to the organisations.

contact.title: Contact us
contact.agreement-text-1: By checking this box you agree that the data you provide in this form will be used solely with the purpose of sending you a response to your query. Here you can find
contact.agreement-text-2: our regulations with regards to processing of personal data.

privacy-policy.title: Cookie Policy
privacy-policy.content: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed molestie, dui et viverra luctus, urna massa lobortis dui, vel lacinia metus ipsum egestas mauris. Duis placerat, enim ut bibendum maximus, nunc lectus sodales mi, sit amet volutpat neque ante viverra dui.
privacy-policy.content-general-text1: This website uses cookies in order to provide users with a better browsing experience as well as services tailored to their needs and interests.
privacy-policy.content-general-text2: “Cookies” are used to facilitate access and delivery for the services required by Internet users such as personalizing settings (language, country, prices displayed in local currency etc.)
privacy-policy.content-general-text3: “Cookies”, based on the information about users that they gather, help operators make their websites more effective so that they can be easier to access by users. They also make online advertising more effective and can help multimedia apps and content from other websites be more easily embedded, to make navigation easier.
privacy-policy.content-privacy1-text1: Cookie (“browser cookie“ or “HTTP cookie“) is a small file, a succession of letters and numbers, that is stored on any terminal with Internet access (computers, mobile phones, tablets etc.) and is installed upon a request from a server to a browser (ex: Internet Explorer, Chrome). “Cookies” do not contain any software programs, viruses or spyware and cannot access information on the user’s hard drive.
privacy-policy.content-privacy1-text2: Cookie consists of a name and content, the length of its existence is limited, and it can be accessed again by the webserver when a user returns to the website associated with that server.
privacy-policy.content-privacy1-text3: Cookies do not request personal information nor do they personally identify internet users.
privacy-policy.content-privacy1-text4: Session cookies - are cookies temporarily stored in the browser’s history where they are stored until the user leaves that website or closes the browser window.
privacy-policy.content-privacy1-text5: Persistent Cookies - These are stored, for a predetermined length of time, on a computer hard drive or similar equipment. Persistent cookies include those placed by a different website than the one the user is visiting at the time, so-called “third-party cookies”- that can be anonymously used to track a user’s interests - allowing them to receive ads more relevant to their interests.
privacy-policy.content-privacy2-text1: A cookie contains information that connects users to a specific website. If a browser accesses the same server again it can read the information already stored in the cookie and react accordingly.
privacy-policy.content-privacy3-title: What is the average lifespan of a cookie?
privacy-policy.content-privacy3-text1: There are cookies that are exclusively used for a single session - these are no longer stored after the user has left the website. Permanent cookies are stored and reused every time the user returns to that website but can be deleted at any time by the user.
privacy-policy.content-privacy4-text1: Some parts of the content or services on the accessed website can be placed there by third parties via banners, boxes or links - and all these instruments can contain cookies. These are called “third-party cookies” because they are not placed by the owner of the respective website, third party cookies do however have to abide by the law and by the site owner’s confidentiality policy.
privacy-policy.content-privacy5-title: How does this website use cookies?
privacy-policy.content-privacy5-text1: Upon visiting this website you may receive the following cookie types:
privacy-policy.content-privacy5-li1: Cookies that are used to analyse general user data
privacy-policy.content-privacy5-text2: Some cookies can be third-party cookies.
privacy-policy.content-privacy6-title: Cookies that are used to analyse general user data
privacy-policy.content-privacy6-text1: Every time you visit this website the analytics software provided by a third-party generates a cookie used to analyze the user profile. Cookie tells us if you've ever visited this website before. The browser will let us know if you have this cookie installed, and if not, this cookie is generated. This allows us to Monitor the number of unique users visiting this website as well as how often they return. This cookie cannot be used to identify physical persons and it is only used for statistical purposes.
privacy-policy.content-privacy7-text1: When registering to this website, we generate a cookie with your registration data. The cookie helps us in the next steps for communicating with the server. It is possible for this cookie to remain on your device if you do not follow through with all the registration steps. However, this cookie will be overwritten the next time you attempt to register on this website.
privacy-policy.content-privacy8-text1: On some pages third parties can set up their own anonymous cookies for purposes of tracking an app’s success rate, or for customizing that app. Due to the way it is used, this website cannot access these cookies, just as third parties cannot access the cookies that belong to this website. For example when you share a page using a “share to social network” button on this website, that social network can track your activity.
privacy-policy.content-privacy9-title: What kind of information is stored and accessed through cookies?
privacy-policy.content-privacy9-text1: Cookies save information in a small text file allowing a website to recognize a browser. The web server will recognize the browser up until the cookie expires or is deleted. The cookie stores important information that improve the browsing experience (e.g. a serial number for a payment)
privacy-policy.content-privacy10-title: Why are cookies important to the Internet?
privacy-policy.content-privacy10-text1: Cookies are one of the most important tools for a seamless, efficient Internet experience, helping to generate friendly browsing experiences tailored to the needs of every user. Refusing to accept cookies or deactivating them can make some websites impossible to use.
privacy-policy.content-privacy10-text2: Refusing to accept cookies or deactivating them does not mean that you will no longer receive online ads, only that these ads will no longer take your interests or preferences into account as determined by your browsing behavior.
privacy-policy.content-privacy11-text1: Cookies are NOT viruses! They use plain text formats. They do not contain code strings and therefore cannot be triggered remotely nor can they activate themselves. They cannot duplicate or self-replicate across networks. As they cannot do any of the above that cannot be considered viruses.
privacy-policy.content-privacy11-text2: However, some cookies can be used for bad purposes. As they can store user preferences and navigation history, both from a specific website and for a broad selection of sites, cookies can be used as a form of spyware. Many anti-spyware products know this and constantly mark cookies to be deleted as part of anti-virus or anti-spyware scans.
privacy-policy.content-privacy11-text3: Most browsers have privacy settings allowing you to select the types of cookies to accept, their duration as well as auto-delete features that remove cookies once the user has visited a certain site.
privacy-policy.content-privacy12-text1: As identity protection is very important and represents the right of every internet user, it is important for you to know what potential problems may be caused by cookies. Because cookies are used to constantly transmit information both ways between the browser and the website, unauthorised persons looking to compromise your security may intercept the information contained by cookies. Although this is very rare it can happen if your browser accesses the website by using an unencrypted network (e.g. an unsecured Wifi network).
privacy-policy.content-privacy12-text2: Other cookie-based attacks use wrong cookie settings on servers. If a website does not ask the browser to use encrypted channels only, attackers can use this vulnerability to trick browsers into sending information via unencrypted channels. Attackers then use this information to access unauthorised websites. It is very important to take great care in choosing the right methods of protecting your personal information.
privacy-policy.content-privacy13-title: Advice for safe and responsible cookie-based browsing
privacy-policy.content-privacy13-text1: To the flexibility and the fact that the majority of the largest and most visited websites use cookies, they are inevitable. Deactivating cookies will no longer allow user access to some of the most important websites such as Youtube, Gmail, Yahoo and others. Here's some advice that can help you browse safely while retaining cookies:
privacy-policy.content-privacy13-li1: Customize your browser cookie settings to allow for a comfortable security level. If cookies are not a problem for you and you are the only person using that device you can set long cookie retention intervals in order to store your browsing history and your personal access data. If you share the device or computer you may want to set up the browser to delete your individual browsing data every time it is closed. This is one way to access websites that place cookies on your shared computer while deleting all your browsing data when closing the session.
privacy-policy.content-privacy13-li2: Install an anti-spyware app and keep it up-to-date
privacy-policy.content-privacy13-text2: Many anti-spyware apps include website attack detection. These apps prevent the browser from accessing websites that might exploit the browser’s vulnerabilities or download dangerous software. Ensure your browser is up-to-date. Many cookie-based attacks exploit the weak points of old browser versions.
privacy-policy.content-privacy13-text3: Cookies are everywhere and cannot be avoided if you wish to access some of the largest and best websites on the internet, either local or international. The clear understanding of the way cookies work and the benefits they bring you can take the necessary security measures so that you always have a safe and satisfactory browsing experience.
privacy-policy.content-privacy14-title: How can I turn cookies off?
privacy-policy.content-privacy14-text1: Refusing to accept cookies or deactivating them can make some websites difficult or impossible to navigate or use. Refusing to accept cookies also does not mean that you will no longer receive online ads.
privacy-policy.content-privacy14-text2: You can set up your browser to reject cookies automatically or you can select only some websites where cookies are enabled. But, for example, if you turn off cookies on this website you can not follow through with the next steps in filling out the form.
privacy-policy.content-privacy14-text3: Modern browsers offer the ability to change cookie settings. You can usually find cookie settings under the “options” tab or the “preferences” menu of your browser.
privacy-policy.content-privacy14-text4: For third-party cookies settings and for more information about online ad confidentiality, IAB Romania offers the following website:

terms-and-conditions.title: Terms and Conditions of Use
terms-and-conditions.content: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed molestie, dui et viverra luctus, urna massa lobortis dui, vel lacinia metus ipsum egestas mauris. Aliquam imperdiet quam eget posuere vulputate. Nunc molestie dignissim dapibus. Aenean laoreet condimentum justo, id finibus nunc luctus ut. Fusce diam ipsum, convallis ac tincidunt eget, finibus vitae ipsum. Vestibulum accumsan nulla eget mi tempor, eget pulvinar elit tincidunt. Ut a euismod nunc. Vivamus non posuere risus. Suspendisse eget nunc imperdiet arcu tincidunt hendrerit blandit quis sem. Quisque eget tellus ut quam dapibus pellentesque non a neque. Duis placerat, enim ut bibendum maximus, nunc lectus sodales mi, sit amet volutpat neque ante viverra dui.
terms-and-conditions.content-general-text1: The General Terms and Conditions of Use establish the general terms and conditions of use of the 'theaterhub.ro' site by potential visitors or beneficiaries.
terms-and-conditions.content-general-text2: “Theaterhub.ro” (hereinafter referred to as “Site”, “Platform”, “theaterhub.ro”) is an online platform developed by the Code for Romania Association (hereinafter referred to as “Code for Romania”) which comes to the aid of professionals in the field of arts, creating a virtual space in which they can present their portfolios and initiate cultural projects.
terms-and-conditions.content-general-text3: Code for Romania is a legal entity, having its headquarters in Bucharest, Alba Iulia Square no. 7, bl I6, 1st floor, ap. 6, registered in the special register, Part A, section I 67 / 06.07.2016.
terms-and-conditions.content-objective1-text: The goal of the platform is to help arts professionals present their portfolios and facilitate the construction of projects and shows without taking into account geographical barriers. At the same time, theaterhub.ro aims to become a community space where artists can help each other, or where the community can intervene with support to carry out projects.
terms-and-conditions.content-objective2-text1: By filling in the form made available for registration, or the newsletter subscription form, theaterhub.ro collects the following personal information:
terms-and-conditions.content-objective2-text2: Within the profile of each user, information about the age, professional experience and studies of each user is collected. This information is made public with the express consent of the user who has full control over the visibility of the information in his profile.
terms-and-conditions.content-objective3-text1: Code for Romania processes personal data only in the interest of the users of the website theaterhub.ro who express their consent to be added as members in the community and / or added to the newsletter database of the platform.
terms-and-conditions.content-objective4-text1: As a theaterhub.ro user, according to Law no. 677/2001, as well as, starting with May 25, 2018, according to the General Regulation on data protection, you have the following rights:
terms-and-conditions.content-objective4-li1: The right to information regarding the processing of personal data by Code for Romania;
terms-and-conditions.content-objective4-li2: The right to access personal data, upon request and free of charge for one request per year;
terms-and-conditions.content-objective4-li3: The right to intervene, rectify or delete personal data, upon request and free of charge;
terms-and-conditions.content-objective4-li41: The right to apply to the National Supervisory Authority for the Processing of Personal Data (based in Bucharest, sector 1, B-dul G-ral. Gheorghe Magheru,
terms-and-conditions.content-objective4-li42: ) or to the judiciary, for the defense of any rights guaranteed by law ;
terms-and-conditions.content-objective4-text2: Starting with May 25, 2018, according to the General Regulation on data protection, the right to restrict processing.
terms-and-conditions.content-objective5-text1: Information safety during the processing of your personal data is a major concern of Code for Romania, therefore all personal data collected during visits on theaterhub.ro are processed according to the legal provisions in force in Romania. Code for Romania uses state-of-the-art technologies and takes all reasonable technical measures to transmit and store personal data in conditions of full security and confidentiality.
terms-and-conditions.content-objective5-text2: All personal data on the site are stored and processed on servers located in the European Union, which fall under the European legislation on personal data protection. No information provided on this site leaves the territory of the European Union.
terms-and-conditions.content-objective5-text3: Code for Romania undertakes not to disclose Personal Data regarding your visits to theaterhub.ro, except for the legal situations or situations presented in this document.
terms-and-conditions.content-objective5-text4: If we discover an incident regarding the security of personal data that poses a risk to the rights and freedoms of our users, we will notify the National Supervisory Authority for the Processing of Personal Data within 72 hours. If the security incident is likely to pose a high risk to your rights and freedoms, you will also be notified.
terms-and-conditions.content-objective6-text: The copyright for all existing information on this Site is owned by Code for Romania. No material on this site may be reproduced in part, in full or modified without the express consent of Code for Romania, the holder of this right.
terms-and-conditions.content-objective6-li2: It is strictly forbidden to use this Site in order to destroy or alter it, its content or security or to discredit or harass theaterhub.ro or Code for Romania.
terms-and-conditions.content-objective6-li3: Code for Romania will apply all technical and organizational security measures to protect the data over which it has control against any situation of accidental or intentional manipulation, loss, destruction or against the access of an unauthorized person.
terms-and-conditions.content-objective7-title: 7. Changes to the Terms and Conditions
terms-and-conditions.content-objective7-text1: The 'General Terms and Conditions of Use' constitutes, in its entirety, an agreement concluded between you and Code for Romania regarding the use of theaterhub.ro.
terms-and-conditions.content-objective7-text2: Code for Romania reserves the right to revise and update the 'General Terms and Conditions of Use' at any time, without prior notice or acceptance by users.
terms-and-conditions.content-objective7-text3: If you have any questions regarding the information contained in this page, please write to us at
terms-and-conditions.content-objective8-text1: Code for Romania is an independent, apolitical non-governmental organization, established in 2016, whose goal is to mobilize young IT professionals to create digital tools that help solve social problems. Code for Romania is established and operates in accordance with Romanian law, the articles of incorporation and its statute and
terms-and-conditions.content-objective8-text2: For any questions or concerns, as well as for the exercise of your rights related to the processing of Personal Data by Code for Romania, you can contact us at:
terms-and-conditions.content-objective8-text3: Address: Alba Iulia Square no. 7, bl I6, 1st floor, ap. 6, Bucharest, Romania
